creator: chip@force-elite.com
text:
I haven't had a chance to debug it, but with 'SSLEngine Optional' in -trunk, the
server has a duplicated 'Ugrade' header.

Headers from  http://svn.northnitch.com/

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Date: Thu, 02 Dec 2004 03:28:42 GMT
Server: Apache/2.1.2-dev (Unix) mod_ssl/2.1.2-dev OpenSSL/0.9.7c-p1 DAV/2 SVN/1.1.1
Upgrade: TLS/1.0, HTTP/1.1
Upgrade: TLS/1.0, HTTP/1.1
Last-Modified: Sat, 29 May 2004 06:45:19 GMT
ETag: "5868bd-487-91401dc0"
Accept-Ranges: bytes
Content-Length: 1159
Content-Type: text/html; charset=ISO-8859-1

creator: jorton@redhat.com
text: Looks like it's added in both the Fixup and Access hooks.

This was happening since Upgrade was being added in both main and subrequest. 
Fixed on trunk:

http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?view=rev&revision=592457
creator: jorton@redhat.com
